content.description: A researcher is investigating whether a new fertilizer affects the yield of tomato plants. As part of an experiment, 20 plants will be randomly assigned the new fertilizer and 20 will be assigned the current fertilizer. The mean number of tomatoes produced per plant will be recorded for each fertilizer, and the difference in the sample means will be calculated.
content.question: Which of the following is the appropriate inference procedure for analyzing the results of the experiment?

choices.label: A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a mean difference
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between sample means
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between population means
A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a sample mean
A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population mean

content.answer: A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between population means

topic.text: 7.6: Confidence Intervals for the Difference of Two Means

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
